author: YolmzWelra

text:
It's a software for playing music. Kinda like Windows Media Player. It was very popular back in the days. Like waaaaay back. Probably around 2005 or so (maybe even earlier). Unlike modern softwares, like iTunes and Spotify, Winamp can only play music that you already have on your pc.

I remember that Winamp was very early with visualizers, something that is not used so much anymore. I still like the visualizers. Sometimes I put on some old psychedelic old progressive rock or some sweet, chill, but psychedelic ambient and then let the visualizer on Winamp run on a big screen. Ah man that's awesome!
author: YolmzWelra

text:
They still update Winamp, but they're not aiming to be like Spotify/iTunes and Pandora. Just another, very good media player.

Yes I do, but Winamp take visualizers one step further. Instead of just having bars they have a lot of different animations that move according to the music. I can't really put in words how they look like.

author: José Eduardo

text:
10,000 B.C. was my favorite time period in the game because it had advanced technology, magic, and had a mystical yet otherworldly feel to it that the rest of the game lacked.  The future was just crapsack, but it had to be in order to give the rest of the game an excuse to continue whereas the other periods were cliche (nothing wrong with that, medieval times are expected to seem and be medieval for example.) 

I kinda liked 65 million BC because of the reptile people, but they died out.  I think 1,000 A.D. is supposed to correlate to the present despite it being a primitive somewhat post-apocalyptic (fall of Rome and all) time in real life.  What I really loved about 1,000 A.D. was the mystics were still alive whereas anything that takes place in contemporary times typically has old mystical races go extinct.  Speaking of which this is what makes Shadowrun kinda cool, elves and dwarfs and such live in a near future cyber-punk world.  1999 would have been a very awesome time to explore at least for a bonus level to uncover extra lore, background, unanswered questions, and such.

text:
Let's not forget the slight undertones of racism that the Enlightened Ones had for the Earthbound Ones. The Dark Ages or, "Antiquity" (blegh, it'll always be Dark Ages in my eyes) really did shift the story abruptly but timely, and put the whole thing into a new perspective. Plus, the whole floating continent thing, to escape the ice cold, many millenia winter the Earthbound Ones had to face...

This entire story is just brilliant. I can't see how anyone could NOT love this game.

text:
lol i still have it.
oh btw by extracting i mean saving the whole song on HD without disturbing sounds.
heres how to do it:
google for the ZSNES emulator, best emu arounf
google for chrono trigger rom
setup zsnes and load chrono trigger
dont make the song you want start yet
hit F1 in game to make a capture window appear
click "save spc data"
force the song to start (like in sound test)
you will get a message that the file was saved successfully
the file will be in the capture folder
